item.title: Innovate!Europe – Irish winners selected from Dublin event
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Finalists Announced from Dublin Workshop : Innovate!Europe. These eleven companies will now advance to the Master Class, to be held in Zaragoza, Spain May 4-6. Congratulations go to: Byte Surgery/Decisions for Heroes â€“ tools to enable emergency rescue personnel and volunteers to collect and analyze data at emergency scenes Emergence â€“ SaaS application that provides [...]
item.content:encoded:
Finalists Announced from Dublin Workshop : Innovate!Europe.

These eleven companies will now advance to the Master Class, to be held in Zaragoza, Spain May 4-6. Congratulations go to:

Byte Surgery/Decisions for Heroes â€“ tools to enable emergency rescue personnel and volunteers to collect and analyze data at emergency scenes

Emergence â€“ SaaS application that provides real-time risk management across a range of corporate business functions

iFoods Ltd/LookandTaste.com â€“ professionally-produced and user-generated digital video library of recipes; online video glossary of food and kitchen terms

IGoPeople â€“ software that socially connects consumers and businesses to better build brands and enable consumer involvement in marketing

Locle â€“ location-aware social networking tools to identify people and places on mobile devices

LouderVoice â€“ SaaS application that enables customers to review products and provide feedback on business sites

PutPlace â€“ cloud storage platform for consumer PC- and Web-based digital media and information

Revahealth â€“ online directory of health clinics, providing a detailed and normalized view of services and medical personnel

Sentry Wireless â€“ security for mobile phone devices by providing a firewall on a SIM card. First product is a service that insures the privacy and safety of children when using mobile phones

Toddle â€“ provides easy-to-create email marketing campaigns for small businesses, leveraging the tools with which customers are already familiar: Outlook and a browser

TouristR â€“ interactive online travel planner that allows users to plan, book and share their travel with an innovative search tool

================================

Now Innovate!Europe are looking for other Europeâ€™s top startup – and the deadline to apply is March 23rd.

Innovate!Europe will be hosting Going Global workshops and networking meetups in Europe and Israel from March 30th – April 8th – check calendar

Start-ups will receive mentoring and feedback from Guidewire Groupâ€™s renowned analyst team on how to improve your pitch and hone the skills you need to compete in fast-paced markets like Silicon Valley.

Best of all, there is no cost to apply or to participate in the Going Global workshops.

Start-ups in the workshops held so far have raved about the experience. Conor Oâ€™Neill of LouderVoice, called it â€œpure goldâ€ and said it was â€œthe most impressive start-up workshop I have ever encountered.â€

If you want to participate in the competition but canÂ¹t attend one of the workshops, fill out the form anyway.

If you’re selected, Guidewire Group’s analysts will conduct a phone interview with you.

Note: You donâ€™t need to be a workshop participant to attend one of the networking meetups. The meetups are also open to investors, journalists and other members of the entrepreneurial community. However, an RSVP is required as space is limited.

item.title: Innovate!Europe Pure Gold
item.dc:creator: conor
item.description: Last Wednesday saw the team from Guidewire host a leg ofÂ Innovate!Europe in The Digital Exchange in Dublin. And what a day! Chris Shipley, Mike Sigal and Carla Thompson ran the most impressive start-up workshop I have ever encountered. If you missed it, you really missed out. The format was very simple. There were approx 12 [...]
item.content:encoded:
Last Wednesday saw the team from Guidewire host a leg ofÂ Innovate!Europe in The Digital Exchange in Dublin. And what a day! Chris Shipley, Mike Sigal and Carla Thompson ran the most impressive start-up workshop I have ever encountered. If you missed it, you really missed out.

The format was very simple. There were approx 12 Irish startups there including PutPlace, IGOpeople, LouderVoice, Locle, Toddle. The day kicked off with each of us giving a 90 second elevator pitch. Then we gave our 10 minute company pitch and got feedback from the Guidewire team.

That feedback was accurate, fair, pointed and deeply useful. I gave the first company pitch of the day and everything I heard back from them was spot-on. During the rest of the day I was able to refine the deck quite a bit.

However, it was’t just the feedback on our own presentation that was valuable, it was hearing about the problems (and successes) in everyone else’s that made the day so special. As the afternoon progressed, we had more and more discussions involving everyone. This included some excellent insights from Ray Walsh in Enterprise Ireland.

One thing I did notice was the difference between the expectations of Â Valley VCs Â and Irish ones. I was told I could easily ditch my detailed financials slide in a Valley pitch. I was told the complete opposite as part of the Genesis programme.

The Innovate!Europe roadshow then moved to London on Friday. The remaining venues are:

  • 31 MARCH in Bern, Switzerland
  • 3 APRIL in Berlin, Germany
  • 6 APRIL in Paris, France

If you are a start-up based on the continent, you owe it to your business to attend one of these sessions.Â The best companies from the roadshow will then attend a Masterclass in Zaragosa Spain in May. The best of those will take part in a Trade Mission to the Valley in June.

Thanks again to Chris and the team for an invaluable day.

item.title: Irish companies for InnovateEurope
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: I met up with Mike Sigal from Guidewire Group this week at LeWeb in Paris – and he updated me on the new Innovate Europe event they are running. In a nutshell Mike, Chris and their team are - Running regional “Auditions” in Europe to meet and talk to startups [22nd Jan, Dublin] - Selected [...]
item.content:encoded:
I met up with Mike Sigal from Guidewire Group this week at LeWeb in Paris – and he updated me on the new Innovate Europe event they are running.

In a nutshell Mike, Chris and their team are

- Running regional “Auditions” in Europe to meet and talk to startups [22nd Jan, Dublin]

- Selected startups are invited to the Innovate!Europeâ€™s Master Class [4-6 May 2009 in Zaragoza, Spain]

- Also participate in Innovate!Europe Trade Mission – that will visit Silicon Valley in June 2009

- One European startup will win an exclusive spot at Guidewire STUDIO, an in-residence business accelerator in the heart of Silicon Valley.

I would recommend all Web2Ireland companies to apply for Innovate!Europe
